Description: Lip, wall and handle sherd (mended from four fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery bowl; interior glazed, with three red bands lined in white; exterior: tongue frieze between lines at top of lip; in lip zone, large floral ornament to right of handle; part of a sphinx to right; red on alternate petal of large floral ornament and on alternate section of wing of the sphinx; incision used for details of sphinx; below, bands of: meander hooks, alternate rosettes and sets of verticals, key maeander; outer face of handle painted black.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243, no. 3)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.225)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 1020, pl. 124)
